https://jenkins.openbmc.org/job/ci-repository/56168/ : ABORTED
do we enter into this function if we don't have PLDM_FILE_TYPE_VPD_KEYWORD ? what is the need for this check ?
if the asked length is less than the size of the file, we need to return an ERROR back.

why do we need 4 different variables for just the path ? just make it one constexpr.

and this should be under /tmp/pldm/<> .
if the file already exists ? what happens to the subsequent read command? does the file gets appended ? or replaced ? was this tested ?
added a remove file in the end so the keyword file gets removed in success or error case
please print errno, traces like this will not help us debug problems.
The read in the line 73 is to check if the file was written with required size as expected ? Should we add a error trace at line 75 ?
please mantain the doxygen formatting correct.
@varsha also I see that you need a change in file_io.h to add the new type which us missing here ?
that is in a different commit https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/libpldm/+/58013
can we use try-catch to handle the exceptions if any ?
Please set the error log severity using pldm::utils::reportError
Please set the error log severity using pldm::utils::reportError
please add more details here, one line is not sufficient to understand the changes you are making.
please also print e.what(), if we enter here, we should know which exception we got to be able to debug the problem.
the write into file can fail as well, please check for the status and throw an error, reference : https://en.cppreference.com/w/cpp/io/basic_ios/bad
Can you please change this to "This commit is to support a new VPD"
